title: How can i pre-define custom setting in Firefox?
content:
How can i customize Firefox with my own privacy-settings and save those settings for a new installation? Each time after installing Firefox i must go trough all the settings once again. To avoid this time consuming steps, is there a way to import all user-specific-settings for a new installation? The screenshot i attached below clearly shows IT IS POSSIBLE to pre-edit firefox settings for a new installation. Question remains, how can i do that?

For example i wish to always use those settings: (all set to false)

toolkit.telemetry.enabled privacy.resistFingerprinting geo.enable extensions.pocket.enabled media.peerconnection.enabled browser.urlbar.placeholderName > DuckDuckGo

-nevery remember history -dns over https -block tracking content in all windows (not only private) -block cross site and social media tracking -ublock origin extension active -delete cookies and site data when firefox is closed -enable https only mode in all windows

title: Pop-up Blocker Wildcard
content:
Does anyone know how to use an ACTUAL wildcard in the pop-up blocker whitelist? Everything I find online just says to use the domain and it will allow everything from that domain, but that doesn't work in my experience. My work uses a Citrix client so I can log in from home, and the URL changes depending on what servers are available at the time. It's a massive company, so they have dozens of servers, and it would take me forever to try and whitelist them all.

The URLs are structured as https://server-aa11.login.company.com. So I need to be able to whitelist everything from login.company.com. In Chrome, I do this using [*.]login.company.com and I have no problems with it, but I have been trying to use FF instead of Chrome recently as Chrome has been having problems for me on Windows 11.

Anyone have any advice?
creator: aacrabtree
